title: Situational preferences
description: Situational – everyday partnership moments (plans, communication, boundaries, energy, quality, leadership). Answer how true each statement feels for you.

questions.text: If plans shift to a new place or activity I didn’t research, I’m comfortable pivoting and discovering as we go.
questions.question_text: If plans shift to a new place or activity I didn’t research, I’m comfortable pivoting and discovering as we go.

questions.text: When invited to a themed community night or class that’s new to me, I’m likely to attend and try at least one thing.
questions.question_text: When invited to a themed community night or class that’s new to me, I’m likely to attend and try at least one thing.
questions.follow_up: What would help you feel comfortable trying something new?

questions.text: When the vibe turns from playful to focused, I can set or follow a brief intention so the moment feels meaningful (e.g., a breath, a phrase, a look).
questions.question_text: When the vibe turns from playful to focused, I can set or follow a brief intention so the moment feels meaningful (e.g., a breath, a phrase, a look).

questions.text: Before big shared moments (date, trip, project), small rituals help me show up fully.
questions.question_text: Before big shared moments (date, trip, project), small rituals help me show up fully.
questions.follow_up: If you have one, what’s a small ritual that helps you arrive?

questions.text: If my partner seems hesitant mid-activity, I pause and check in without losing warmth or care.
questions.question_text: If my partner seems hesitant mid-activity, I pause and check in without losing warmth or care.

questions.text: For higher-stakes plans, I prefer clear safety plans and simple check-ins to guide us (before, during, after).
questions.question_text: For higher-stakes plans, I prefer clear safety plans and simple check-ins to guide us (before, during, after).

questions.text: If conversation gets tangled, I can slow down, reflect back what I heard, and help restore shared language.
questions.question_text: If conversation gets tangled, I can slow down, reflect back what I heard, and help restore shared language.

questions.text: When I feel stirred up, I can regulate myself enough to name what I need (time-out, clarification, a breath) without escalating.
questions.question_text: When I feel stirred up, I can regulate myself enough to name what I need (time-out, clarification, a breath) without escalating.

questions.text: Under time pressure, I’m comfortable making a clear call and getting us moving, then refining on the fly.
questions.question_text: Under time pressure, I’m comfortable making a clear call and getting us moving, then refining on the fly.

questions.text: In public or group settings, I can set boundaries with others confidently while keeping my partner centered.
questions.question_text: In public or group settings, I can set boundaries with others confidently while keeping my partner centered.

questions.text: Polish matters to me: I like aligning on standards (presentation, timing, setup) so the experience feels elevated.
questions.question_text: Polish matters to me: I like aligning on standards (presentation, timing, setup) so the experience feels elevated.

questions.text: I enjoy slowing down to improve technique together, even if it means fewer but higher-quality moments.
questions.question_text: I enjoy slowing down to improve technique together, even if it means fewer but higher-quality moments.

questions.text: When the energy dips, playful challenges or tiny games help me re-ignite momentum for us.
questions.question_text: When the energy dips, playful challenges or tiny games help me re-ignite momentum for us.

questions.text: I’m good at shifting a heavy or awkward mood toward lightness without ignoring feelings.
questions.question_text: I’m good at shifting a heavy or awkward mood toward lightness without ignoring feelings.

questions.text: I like building small experiments into plans so we can learn quickly.
questions.question_text: I like building small experiments into plans so we can learn quickly.

questions.text: Naming beginnings and endings helps me (and others) shift state together.
questions.question_text: Naming beginnings and endings helps me (and others) shift state together.

questions.text: I naturally set gentle routines and check-ins when stakes rise.
questions.question_text: I naturally set gentle routines and check-ins when stakes rise.

questions.text: In tense moments, I can translate feelings into one clear sentence that helps us align.
questions.question_text: In tense moments, I can translate feelings into one clear sentence that helps us align.

questions.text: I’m comfortable offering A/B choices to create quick alignment in groups.
questions.question_text: I’m comfortable offering A/B choices to create quick alignment in groups.

questions.text: I notice small environment tweaks (lighting, music, layout) that would improve comfort and focus.
questions.question_text: I notice small environment tweaks (lighting, music, layout) that would improve comfort and focus.

questions.text: I like using light dares or timers to keep momentum without pressure.
questions.question_text: I like using light dares or timers to keep momentum without pressure.
